soc.interpretation: High organic carbon (39.3%) - excellent soil health

clay.interpretation: Clay-dominated soil (316%) - high fertility but may have drainage issues

cec.interpretation: High nutrient holding capacity (255.8 cmol/kg) - excellent for agriculture

bdod.description: Bulk density of fine earth fraction

limitations: Alkaline soil may cause nutrient deficiencies
Heavy clay soil - drainage may be poor

management_recommendations: Add sulfur or organic acids to lower pH from 66.7 to neutral range
Improve drainage through raised beds or subsurface drainage systems
Avoid field operations when soil is wet to prevent compaction

limitations: Alkaline soil may cause nutrient deficiencies
Heavy clay soil - drainage may be poor

Avoid field operations when soil is wet to prevent compaction

strongly_acidic.management: Heavy lime application needed, add organic matter
strongly_acidic.nutrient_availability: Iron and aluminum toxicity possible, phosphorus deficiency likely

moderately_acidic.management: Moderate lime application, maintain organic matter
moderately_acidic.nutrient_availability: Good for most nutrients, may need phosphorus supplementation

slightly_acidic.nutrient_availability: Excellent nutrient availability for most elements

alkaline.management: Add sulfur or organic acids, improve drainage

clay_soils.characteristics: High water retention, slow drainage, high fertility potential
clay_soils.challenges: Poor drainage, compaction risk, slow warming
clay_soils.management: Improve drainage, avoid working when wet, add organic matter

sandy_soils.characteristics: Good drainage, low water retention, easy to work
sandy_soils.advantages: Good aeration, easy cultivation, quick warming
sandy_soils.challenges: Nutrient leaching, drought susceptible, low fertility

loamy_soils.characteristics: Ideal agricultural soil with balanced properties
loamy_soils.advantages: Good water retention and drainage, fertile, easy to work

very_low.management: Heavy organic matter addition, cover crops, reduced tillage
very_low.impact: Poor soil structure, low fertility, erosion risk

low.management: Regular compost addition, crop residue retention

high.impact: Excellent fertility, structure, and water retention
